means: 消失( vanish的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Their son watched helplessly as they vanished beneath the waves.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的儿子无助地看着他们消失在大浪中。

sentence.Network_en: He vanished after you fixed him with a job.
sentence.Network_cn: 你给他安排好工作后他就突然不见了。

sentence.Network_en: The old sense of deference and restraint in royal reporting has vanished.
sentence.Network_cn: 在对皇室进行的新闻报道中，那种由来已久的尊重和收敛意识已经消失了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Jiaxi | 栖 ... 说的， spoken, 消失的， vanished, 没说的。 unspoken.
a man who mysteriously vanished from his home last month ., 上个月从家中神秘失踪的一名男子.
His anger vanished and he burst out laughing ., 他的怒气烟消云散 , 转而放声大笑.
The ghost vanished the moment the cock began to crow ., 公鸡一开始叫 , 鬼魂就消失了.
